intro: Hibiscus sebastianii, commonly known as the Sebastian's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its striking, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant has velvety, waxy leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Hibiscus sebastianii thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a notable species in the flora of Socotra.
